p.s: The given excerpt is a key moment of the novel.
It also shows the so mystereousmysterious, self confident and also very brave man Gatsby, in a very different way.
In a scared, embarrassed almost a little childish way.
To start ofoff I will talk about the weather which plays a very important role in this excerpts.
On the one hand when Daisy first enters the house and Gatsby went outside the weather is very bad.
This is connected to Gatsby's emotions because heshe's scared of meeting Daisy after all these years.
He is scared of what her reaction to him is and whether she feels the same as him.
On the other hand when Nick were outside for some time and Gatsby's and Daisy's goes very well the weather clears up and it shows the relief and hapinesshappiness of Gatsby (p. 86, l. 28).
The sun even starts shining which is a generally known sign for good mood and hapinesshappiness.
The weather also shows the tension of the excertexcerpt.
The rain keeps getting worse (p. 84, l. 20) until it is clear that they both are happy to see each other again.
Next I will talk about the clock a symbol for the past.
Gatsby who had a relationship with Daisy a long time ago wishes for nothing more than to get Daisy back and in some way get the past back or make it his future.
When the tension is the highest and the conversaton dried out Gatsby throws the clock down by excidentaccident.
Luckily he catches it without it breaking.

In this moment it is not yet clear wetherwhether it is going good or bad and that clock which represents the past and the future almost breaks because in this moment Gatsby's life goal or plan to get Daisy back could now break and all the effort of the parties and everything he did to get her back could have been just pointless.
Furthermore his future life with Daisy could not work out.
In the end though the meeting goes very well that is why the clock does not break neither does his future plans nor all the things he did and their relationship in the past.
The way Gatsby is described throughout the excerpt changes.
In the beginning he is being described as pale as death (p. 84, l. 14), hands plunged like weights (p. 84, l. 15) and it is said that he looks at Nick in a tragically way (p. 84, l. 16).
These metaphors are all signs for how scared he really is.
Furthermore they present him in a very different way as in the rest of the book where he is self confident, talkative way.
Then when the conversation dries out he stops taking part of it, showed by the metaphor got himself in the shadow (p. 85, l. 23).
This behaviour also does not fit his character.
Also he seems to be unhappy with how it is going (p. 85, l. 25).
The switch in how heshe's describesdescibred comes after Nick enters the house again when their conversation seemed to have been going great and the great relief comes over Gatsby.
He being described with metaphors like glowing (p. 87, l. 14).
FuthermoreFurthermore the Gatsby as we know him is back as he is confident and happy again.
He even invites them over to his mansion.
You can really tell how enthusiastic he is by the way he greets Nick and how it is described by an exaggeration (p. 87 l. 16).
To come to an end we really get to know a different side of Gatsby.
Moreover we see that this great man also has a soft childish and scared side.
This really gives the reader a deeper insight into GatsbysGatsby's character.
That and because it is the first meeting of Gatsby and Daisy and the tension which beautifully delivered make this excerpt a very important passage of the book and also one of my favorite ones.
